markdownRemark.html:
Installation media is a disk image created using linux dd tools and compressed with xz compression tools.

In order to install it, you must extract the file using xz decompression tools such as :

* Windows OS - [Open XZ](http://www.unziplite.com/open-xz/)
* OSX - [Unarchiver](https://theunarchiver.com/)
* Linux (ubuntu) - sudo apt install xz-utils

When the decompression complete, you should receive an .iso file. Then use tools such as :

* Windows OS - [Rufus](https://rufus.ie/)
* OSX - [Etcher](https://www.balena.io/etcher/)
* Linux - plain old dd will work

It is highly recommended to use SSD as the target source instead of USB flash disk. Overtime USB Flashdisk can degrade significantly due to continuous read and write operations.

If you must use USB FlashDisk then use the LiveISO instead of using the DiskImage version.

Writing the iso file content to the target disk is pretty straight forward process, under Rufus, you just need to select the SSD drive and the Iso source file and begin the imaging process.

Under Linux, you can invoke dd command such as :

sudo dd if=/path/to/iso of=/dev/sdx

where sdx is the SSD target listed in linux /dev/

Upon installation completion, you may need to enlarge the root partition for more space storage by using tool such as parted
